word_mean: 衍变：进化过程中物种的演变
蜕变：一种化学元素演变为另一元素，核子学上是指一种原子核通过核轰击演变为原子序数不同的核，导致质子和中子的重排
一种核素到另一种核素的转变。

sentence.Network_en: The transmutation of the elements was no longer the privilege of the radioactive substances alone.
sentence.Network_cn: 元素的衍变不再是放射性物质独具的特点.

sentence.Network_en: This transmutation of the old into new life is seen everywhere in China.
sentence.Network_cn: 在中国到处可以看到这种从旧生活转变为新生活的事例.

sentence.Network_en: The real act of transmutation can be very difficult.
sentence.Network_cn: 真正的转化行为会是非常困难的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, or from late Latin transmutatio(n-), from the verb transmutare (see transmute)

entry.def: If something transmutes or is transmuted into a different form, it is changed into that form.

example.ex: She ceased to think, as anger transmuted into passion...
example.tran: 当怒火转化为激情，她停止了思考。

example.ex: Scientists transmuted matter into pure energy and exploded the first atomic bomb.
example.tran: 科学家将物质转化为纯粹的能量，引爆了第一颗原子弹。

means.word_mean: 1. an act that changes the form or character or substance of something
3. (physics) the change of one chemical element into another (as by nuclear decay or radioactive bombardment);

sentences.sentence: "the transmutation of base metals into gold proved to be impossible"
